intro: Dionysia khuzistanica, commonly known as the Khuzistan dionysia, is a flowering plant native to Iran. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to its harsh native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
